channel.title: Glitch
channel.description:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MGz1jjCV6z0[/youtube]
Gold prices have dropped drastically in the last 24/48 hours. I'm assuming there will be a roll back pretty soon because this is by far the most widely abused dupe since the party hat dupe.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/oZcgj.png[/img]
I was thinking about going out and buying 100M or so but I've been reading that there is likely going to be a rollback of accounts that receive huge cash piles for nothing :s That is all speculation as of now though..
Thoughts on this?

item.title: Glitch
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:48, topic:453105”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=555955.msg4075591#msg4075591 date=1344795835]
how did you come up with that figure taharok? Where I iworked prior to my current job we had over a terabyte for just a little three months of work and we had no where as in depth system as jagex probably has
[/quote]

Arbitrarily. If you reverse engineer it, you’ll see that it comes out to almost 380 bytes per tick, which is plenty more than is needed. As far as the 150 years thing comes in, that was a figure proposed by Jagex on how much total online time there is. I might have that number wrong, though.

Edit: Unfortunately, I was wrong about the total time. Jagex said that players have racked up over 443 billion minutes of gametime, which comes down to 4.43 * 10^13 game ticks. Assuming ticks can be compressed to around 10 bytes (which is feasible, in the least), it would lead to a requirement of around 443 terrabytes of logs since launch. I’m assuming this is from start, and doesn’t include idle time. Uncompressed, that’s a lot more than I said before. Nevertheless, terrabyte harddrives can be purchased for $100 each, or less nowadays. That means to approximately store all logs for all time played on RuneScape, Jagex would only need to have around $44,300 in storage space, according to today’s costs.

Not bad. And besides, they would only need to store about a year worth.[/quote]I still can’t imagine that amount of information being stored o.o

Read full topic

Arbitrarily. If you reverse engineer it, you’ll see that it comes out to almost 380 bytes per tick, which is plenty more than is needed. As far as the 150 years thing comes in, that was a figure proposed by Jagex on how much total online time there is. I might have that number wrong, though.[/quote]

443 billion minutes. 840,000 years.

http://www.runescape.com/200million/infographics.ws

Read full topic

item.title: Glitch
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Loveandpower:

how did you come up with that figure taharok? Where I iworked prior to my current job we had over a terabyte for just a little three months of work and we had no where as in depth system as jagex probably has

Arbitrarily. If you reverse engineer it, you’ll see that it comes out to almost 380 bytes per tick, which is plenty more than is needed. As far as the 150 years thing comes in, that was a figure proposed by Jagex on how much total online time there is. I might have that number wrong, though.

Edit: Unfortunately, I was wrong about the total time. Jagex said that players have racked up over 443 billion minutes of gametime, which comes down to 4.43 * 10^13 game ticks. Assuming ticks can be compressed to around 10 bytes (which is feasible, in the least), it would lead to a requirement of around 443 terrabytes of logs since launch. I’m assuming this is from start, and doesn’t include idle time. Uncompressed, that’s a lot more than I said before. Nevertheless, terrabyte harddrives can be purchased for $100 each, or less nowadays. That means to approximately store all logs for all time played on RuneScape, Jagex would only need to have around $44,300 in storage space, according to today’s costs.

Not bad. And besides, they would only need to store about a year worth.

Read full topic

item.title: Glitch
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:29, topic:453105”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=555955.msg4070971#msg4070971 date=1344349696]

how the fuck could they tell who abused this? most people would have dumped the gold by now and profited

It’s very easy if they log every action that happens. Simple exchange network analysis will give them pathways connecting all trades with illegitimate gold.
[/quote]

If they logged every action wouldn’t that be super resource intensive? I was always under the belief that they didn’t log how gold was created. [/quote]

I approximated how much room it would take to log around 150 years of logs, where each tick is logged as a few bytes. It came out to about 3 terabytes, which isn’t much at all. They could log all actions if they really wanted to.

Read full topic

item.title: Glitch
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Frell:

not if they only store about 2 months worth of logs

If they compress and optimize the logs it would take even less space.

Read full topic
